thread.title: British ISIS fanatic grins before Mosul bomb attack
thread.title_full: British ISIS fanatic grins before Mosul bomb attack

title: British ISIS fanatic grins before Mosul bomb attack
text: comments Smiling in his explosives-laden car, this is the face of a British suicide bomber minutes before he blew himself up in an ISIS attack. The terrorist, named by ISIS as Abu Zakariya al-Britani, was pictured moments before targeting a military facility to the southwest of war-torn Mosul in Iraq . ISIS claim his attack, during a raging battle for control of the city, caused multiple casualties but this has not been confirmed. Pictures online show al-Britani grinning next to what appears to be wires connected to a red-buttoned detonator. ISIS said he was one of two militants involved in the attack on a Shiite army outpost. Scroll down for video The terrorist, named by ISIS as Abu Zakariya al-Britani (above), was pictured moments before targeting a military facility to the southwest of war-torn Mosul in Iraq Footage said to have been captured yesterday morning shows Abu Zakariya's reinforced vehicle setting off along a dusty road The video then cuts to a plume of smoke in the distance after the car bomb is detonated An ISIS statement claimed British suicide bomber Zakariya al-Britani had carried out a deadly attack in Mosul The attack came as Iraqi forces advanced on ISIS positions in the west of the city. Footage said to have been captured yesterday morning shows Abu Zakariya's reinforced vehicle setting off along a dusty road. The video then cuts to a plume of smoke in the distance. A statement released by the terror group today said: 'The martyrdom-seeking brother Abu Zakariya al-Britani - may Allah accept him - detonated his explosives-laden vehicle on a headquarters of the Rafidhi army and its militias in Tal Kisum village, southwest of Mosul.'
